# cosmos

𒆧𒆳 kiš-mat kišmat cosmos

𒆠𒊹 kišar ≈ 𒆧𒆠 ≈ 𒆧𒆳 cosmos
𒆠𒊹 ki-šar₂ horizon, everywhere, the whole earth, totality

𒊹 ŠAR₂ ǦEOR Geo® ♁ kiššatum (“totality, world”)
𒊹 🌍 🌎 🌏 ᴳERDE earth ε Ε≠E! ⇔ 𓊖
𒆕 𒋡𒊑 qaqari ǦEOR 𒋡𒊑𒆕 •ᴳERDE

𒀭𒆠𒋙𒀀 ki-šu-mû kišumû cosm "the extent of heaven and earth"

𒌋 cosmos #šu₄ totality, world

𒄒𒋥 kib-rat four quarters of the cosmos
𒅆𒆳 halib Halbwelt hell! "Netherworld" Akk. irkala

𒆜𒐋 zikura circle "earth" #erşetu

𒇉 engur “underground (waters)” 𒀀𒇉 ID₂ water nārum
𒇉 zikum ziku "sky" 𓈙 𓆄 𓅱 𓀭 | Shuᵇ | sky
𒇉 zikum "the heavens" •spikum 𓋴 𓃀 𓇼 𓏤 'stars' #šamû

Some hieroglyps/concepts look a bit like puzzle pieces for children:
𓇯 air, the word for air is simply written as Air 𓄿
𓎟 all, the word for all is related to 𓎡 kalla=all@Hebrew Kelle=jug@german
𓈋 dval, dual for tell(hill) and Tal(vale) vs
𓏏 tell Delle
𓊃 zəmin ज़मीन zamīn zusammen-zimmern: ground, floor
𓇾 ter, terra, terrain: earth
󴃙 not-air: nature air-de: Erde air-a: aerea (rare sign, 𓇯 180• turned)
𓃹 كَوْن kawn (Cosmos / Sein / Sank 𓃶)

The duality of 𓇯 air and earth 𓇯𓏏 is perfectly captured in these forms:
1. 𓇯 ⇔ 𓇯𓏏
2. air ⇔ earth
3. երկինք jɛɾkin ⇔ երկիր jɛɾkir 󴃙 = 𓇯𓏏 earth երկաթ ⇔ ɑʐəɥɑn
4. 𓇯 air ⇔ հող hɔʁ earth

𓊖 cities built "reproducing the model of the universe" as described in the Vedas and the Avesta!

𒄭 GAL > hole whole cosmos 𒆸 口 kou 𓎟 Kuhle vs 🌍 Kugel?

𓊖 ⇔ 𒌒𒁕 ub-da #arbatu "quarter (of the Universe) " #kibrat urbis & orbis

The division of the world into four quarters and Cardinal points is a core part of the Copper King believe system, featuring especially prominently on painted bowls

As in PIE religions, we have a duality between a potent father sky 𓊪𓏏𓇯 and mother earth 𓅐𓏏𓁐, although both often have partners (dom,dame) or even switch roles 𓏌𓏏𓇯𓁐 Nut(Air) vs Mut(thea) 𓅐𓏏𓁐 Nun & Naunet.
Air 𓇯 vs Erde 𓇯𓏏

𓏌𓏏𓇯𓁐 Nut(Air) Mother sky vs Mut(terr)𓅐 Mother earth

natura "lower heaven" 𓇑𓇑𓈖𓏏𓇯 ante-air "lower heaven"

šar kiššatim ("King of Everything" or "King of the Universe")

Uruk-period worldview: water enables agriculture and animal husbandry, thus feeding people and providing the means for them to fulfill the main duty of their existence: to feed and care for the gods.

𒆧𒆳𒅕𒋛𒋾 kiš-šat er-se-ti | totality, world
𒆧𒆳𒅕𒋛𒋾 kiš-šat er-se-ti | 𒆧𒆠 Kish earth
𒆧𒆳𒅕𒋛𒋾 kiš-šat er-se-ti | свят svjat earth
𒆧𒆳𒅕𒋛𒋾 kiš-šat er-se-ti | __ earth ⇔ աշխարհ ašxarh
𒆧𒆳𒅕𒋛𒋾 kiš-kar er-se-ti | whole 𓎟 earth
𒆧𒆳𒅕𒋛𒋾 kiš-šat ⇔ 世界 sṳ-kie
